content.text: Rory McIlroy of Team Europe reacts on the 14th green during the Saturday afternoon four-balls matches of the 2025 Ryder Cup at Black Course at Bethpage State Park Golf Course on Sept. 27, 2025. Carl Recine/Getty Images hide caption toggle caption Carl Recine/Getty Images Sports Ryder Cup MC steps down over foul-mouthed chant aimed at golfer Rory McIlroy September 28, 2025 • Some of the golf at this year's Ryder Cup has been overshowed by interventions from passionate and unruly fans, as Americans tee off against Europeans in one of the sport's biggest events.

images.alt: Rory McIlroy of Team Europe reacts on the 14th green during the Saturday afternoon four-balls matches of the 2025 Ryder Cup at Black Course at Bethpage State Park Golf Course on Sept. 27, 2025.

News: U.S. and World News Headlines NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.

Rory McIlroy of Team Europe reacts on the 14th green during the Saturday afternoon four-balls matches of the 2025 Ryder Cup at Black Course at Bethpage State Park Golf Course on Sept. 27, 2025. Carl Recine/Getty Images hide caption

toggle caption
Carl Recine/Getty Images

Sports

Ryder Cup MC steps down over foul-mouthed chant aimed at golfer Rory McIlroy

September 28, 2025 • Some of the golf at this year's Ryder Cup has been overshadowed by interventions from passionate and unruly fans, as Americans tee off against Europeans in one of the sport's biggest events.

In this image taken from video released by Julie J, @Malkowski6April, massive flames and smoke rise from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Grand Blanc on Sunday. Julie J, @Malkowski6April/AP hide caption

toggle caption
Julie J, @Malkowski6April/AP

National

Attack at a Mormon church in Michigan leaves at least 1 dead, 9 injured

September 28, 2025 • Multiple people have been shot at a Mormon church in Michigan and the shooter is down, police said Sunday.

Dr. Paul Ransom of the British humanitarian medical NGO UK-Med, assisted by local medical staff, treats patients at a field hospital in Muwasi, near Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip, Saturday, Sept. 27, 2025. Jehad Alshrafi/AP hide caption

toggle caption
Jehad Alshrafi/AP

World

Palestinian death toll tops 66,000 as Netanyahu prepares to meet Trump

September 28, 2025 • The death toll in the Israel-Hamas war has topped 66,000 Palestinians, Gaza's Health Ministry said, a day before the Israeli Prime Minister heads for talks with U.S. President Donald Trump.

Sponsor Message

Neighbors Cupboard volunteers Mike Masnyk and Ellie Jordan unload the morning delivery of produce in Winterport, Maine, on Tuesday, Aug. 26, 2025. Katherine Emery/AP/The Maine Monitor hide caption

toggle caption
Katherine Emery/AP/The Maine Monitor

National

Maine's food pantries stare down volunteer shortage while anticipating cuts

September 28, 2025 • Maine has long been one of the most food insecure states in New England. In March, the Trump administration cut more than $1 billion from two U.S. food programs.

Endangered barrel cactuses known as biznaga are seen growing inside the botanical gardens of the National Autonomous University of Mexico in Mexico City. Rebecca Blackwell/AP hide caption

toggle caption
Rebecca Blackwell/AP

The Americas

The endangered cactus behind Mexico's sweet secret

September 28, 2025 • In Mexico, September means chiles en nogada season. But one key ingredient, a candied barrel cactus called biznaga, is now illegal because it's vanishing in the wild.

In this file photo, Rep. Maria Elvira Salazar, R-Fla., speaks during an event on Capitol Hill on May 1, 2024 in Washington, DC. Leigh Vogel/Getty Images hide caption

toggle caption
Leigh Vogel/Getty Images

Politics

DACA has bipartisan support in Congress. Still, Republicans are following Trump's lead

September 28, 2025 • President Trump failed to revoke DACA in his first term and his focus on immigration this time has mostly ignored the policy. Still, Republican lawmakers are deferring to the president on the issue.

GOP's STANCE ON DACA

Tammy Kremer (left) and Hayley Currier are friends who bought a home together. With housing prices on the rise, some people are purchasing homes with people other than romantic partners. Via Hayley Currier and Getty Images/Emily Bogle/NPR hide caption

toggle caption
Via Hayley Currier and Getty Images/Emily Bogle/NPR

Cost of Living

Why friends are teaming up to buy homes

September 28, 2025 • Buying a home is a conventional milestone for couples. But as home prices skyrocket, many Americans are buying homes with someone who isn't their romantic partner.

CO-BUYING HOMES

Listen · 3:55 3:55
  • Download
  • <iframe src="https://www.npr.org/player/embed/nx-s1-5497777/nx-s1-9470391" width="100%" height="290" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" title="NPR embedded audio player">

People walk near apartment buildings damaged after a Russian attack in Kyiv on Sunday. Efrem Lukatsky/AP hide caption

toggle caption
Efrem Lukatsky/AP

Ukraine invasion — explained

Russian strikes kill 4 in Ukraine as Zelenskyy urges world not to "turn a blind eye"

September 28, 2025 • Zelenskyy called the attacks "pure terrorism" and urged Europe and the U.S. to respond with tougher sanctions and stronger defenses.

Entries in the annual North Dakota State Crop Show competition are displayed at the 88th annual Winter Show in Valley City, N.D. Dan Koeck for NPR hide caption

toggle caption
Dan Koeck for NPR

Up First from NPR

American Voices on Trump

September 28, 2025 • The Trump administration has moved fast to chart a new course for American policy both here at home as well as internationally. But how are those changes impacting  Americans across the country? 

American Voices on Trump

Listen · 27:58 27:58
  • Download
  • <iframe src="https://www.npr.org/player/embed/nx-s1-5554348/nx-s1-mx-5735892" width="100%" height="290" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" title="NPR embedded audio player">

Relatives of people who were killed in a stampede during a rally for a popular Indian actor and politician, mourn outside a hospital, in Karur, in the southern state of Tamil Nadu, Saturday, Sept. 27, 2025. Uncredited/AP hide caption

toggle caption
Uncredited/AP

Asia

Stampede at a political rally for popular actor Vijay in southern India kills 36, injures 40

September 28, 2025 • A stampede at a rally for a popular Indian actor and politician in the southern state of Tamil Nadu killed at least 36 people and injured 40 others.

Sponsor Message

A domestically-built missile and banners showing portraits of the Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, center, and armed forces commanders who were killed in an Israeli strike in June, are displayed in Baharestan Square, Tehran, Thursday, Sept. 25, 2025. Vahid Salemi/AP hide caption

toggle caption
Vahid Salemi/AP

Middle East

UN imposes 'snapback' sanctions on a hungrier, poorer and more anxious Iran

September 28, 2025 • The United Nations reimposed sanctions on Iran early Sunday over its nuclear program, further squeezing the Islamic Republic as its people increasingly find themselves priced out of the food they need to survive and worried about their futures.

Lion Dancers perform in front of a new statue of a Chinese coal miner in Rock Springs, Wyoming called "Requiem" Jenna McMurtry hide caption

toggle caption
Jenna McMurtry

National

Wyoming town erects new monument to violent, anti-immigrant history

September 28, 2025 • At a time when President Trump is going after foreign laborers in the U.S, and saying unflattering accounts of U.S. history should be removed, Rock Springs, Wyoming has put up a new monument to ethnic violence there.

WYOMING UNCOMFORTABLE HISTORY

  • <iframe src="https://www.npr.org/player/embed/nx-s1-5519752/nx-s1-9470202" width="100%" height="290" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" title="NPR embedded audio player">

U.S. Air Force retired Lt. Col. George E. Hardy, a Tuskegee Airman, stands next to his former P-51D Mustang at Royal Air Force Lakenheath, England, Oct. 4, 2016. Senior Airman Malcolm Mayfield/U.S. Air Force hide caption

toggle caption
Senior Airman Malcolm Mayfield/U.S. Air Force

National

George E. Hardy, Tuskegee Airman, dies at 100

September 27, 2025 • George E. Hardy was the youngest Red Tail fighter pilot at 19 years old and completed 21 missions across Europe during World War II.

Marc Maron, who wasn't invited to perform at the Riyadh Comedy Festival, has spoken out against participation in the event, owing to Saudi Arabia's appalling human rights record. Amy Sussman/Getty Images/Getty Images North America hide caption

toggle caption
Amy Sussman/Getty Images/Getty Images North America

Culture

Marc Maron, Human Rights Watch and others slam Saudi comedy festival

September 27, 2025 • The participation of big name funnymen, including Dave Chappelle, Aziz Ansari and Kevin Hart, provoked criticism from fellow comedians and human rights groups.

Stephany Gauffeny talks to NPR on Sept. 27 about her husband Miguel Angel Garcia-Hernandez, a victim of the Sept. 24 shooting at an Dallas ICE facility. Sergio Martínez-Beltrán/NPR hide caption

toggle caption
Sergio Martínez-Beltrán/NPR

Immigration

'I want his name to be known': Wife of immigrant injured at ICE facility shooting speaks out

September 27, 2025 • Stephany Gauffeny says she wants the world to know that her husband, Miguel Angel Garcia-Hernandez, is more than "just an immigrant or a detainee, or a criminal."

Retired Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy attends President Trump's address to a joint session of Congress at the U.S. Capitol on March 4, 2025 in Washington. Win McNamee/Getty Images hide caption

toggle caption
Win McNamee/Getty Images

Review

Book Reviews

'The cases swung, not me': Ex-Justice Kennedy reflects on a changing Supreme Court

September 27, 2025 • In an interview with NPR to be aired in October, Kennedy said he is "very worried" about America today.

A rainfall forecast for Tropical Storm Imelda. National Weather Service hide caption

toggle caption
National Weather Service

Weather

Tropical Storm Imelda expected to batter parts of the southeastern U.S. this week

September 27, 2025 • The National Hurricane Center said Tropical Storm Imelda could intensify as it approaches the East Coast. South Carolina's governor declared a state of emergency.

FBI personnel take a knee with demonstrators that were marching on Pennsylvania Avenue in Washington, D.C., on June 4, 2020, during a protest over the death of George Floyd. Jose Luis Magana/AP hide caption

toggle caption
Jose Luis Magana/AP

National

FBI agents fired, including some shown kneeling during 2020 protests

September 27, 2025 • Agents said the kneeling was an act of deescalation. The Bureau investigated them at the time and found no causes for discipline. The FBI Agents Association decries the lack of due process.

President Trump arrives at the White House on Friday. On Saturday, he said he will send troops to Portland, Ore. Julia Demaree Nikhinson/AP hide caption

toggle caption
Julia Demaree Nikhinson/AP

National

Trump says he will send troops to Portland to deal with 'domestic terrorists'

September 27, 2025 • President Trump is authorizing the deployment of troops to "protect" Portland and ICE facilities there from "domestic terrorists" as he expands his controversial deployments to more U.S. cities.

Anika Orrock for NPR

Life Kit

4 essential conversations every interracial couple should have

September 27, 2025 • For a strong and lasting relationship, don't be afraid to talk about each other's racial differences — and do enjoy the process of creating a new, blended family culture.

The Chicago city skyline. Erin Hooley/AP hide caption

toggle caption
Erin Hooley/AP

Opinion

Simon Says

Opinion: 'Free speech doesn't work just when you agree with it'

September 27, 2025 • NPR's Scott Simon recalls a First Amendment case from the late 1970s involving the rights of a neo-Nazi group to march through a predominantly Jewish suburb of Chicago.

ESSAY 09-27-25

Tim Curry as Dr. Frank-N-Furter in a still from The Rocky Horror Picture Show. Behind him are Patricia Quinn as Magenta, left, and Richard O'Brien as Riff-Raff. Hulton Archive/Getty Images hide caption

toggle caption
Hulton Archive/Getty Images

Culture

'Rocky Horror' is 50! We propose a toast. (You know what to do)

September 27, 2025 • Rocky Horror aficionados used to attend screenings of the film over and over to take notes on the details. Accurately mirroring every line and dance move has gotten easier over time.

‘Rocky Horror’ is still a refuge for fans, 50 years later

The U.S. Capitol is seen as members of the National Guard patrol the National Mall in Washington, D.C. earlier this month. A new NPR-Ipsos poll finds Americans are concerned about crime, but don't broadly support President Trump's deployment of the National Guard to police U.S. cities. Brendan Smialowski/AFP via Getty Images hide caption

toggle caption
Brendan Smialowski/AFP via Getty Images

National

NPR-Ipsos poll: Americans don't broadly support Trump's National Guard deployments

September 27, 2025 • Americans are concerned about crime, but don't broadly support President Trump's deployment of the National Guard to U.S. cities, according to a new NPR-IPSOS poll.

NPR-Ipsos poll shows many Americans oppose Trump’s National Guard deployments

Listen · 5:34 5:34

A food counter menu lists various milkshakes and a Hot Beef Sundae for sale at the New York State Fair in Syracuse, New York, on Friday, August 30, 2024. Ted Shaffrey/AP hide caption

toggle caption
Ted Shaffrey/AP

Culture

How the beloved state fair grew from livestock showcases to cornucopias of amusement

September 27, 2025 • The state fair dates back to the 1800s, and its agricultural roots go back even further. Ever since, states have been putting their own spin on the annual event while staying true to tradition.
